Cases of people who mix closely with oth: A person who is the sweetest of the sweet, the most even-tempered of the even-tempered, the calmest of the calm
A person who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, enters and remains in the first absorption
A person who, as the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, enters and remains in the second absorption
A person who, with the fading away of rapture, enters and remains in the third absorption
A person who, giving up pleasure and pain, enters and remains in the fourth absorption
A person who, not focusing on any signs, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart
Examples of things that could happen des: An ox fond of crops was tied up or shut in a pen
It was raining heavily at the crossroads so that the dust vanished and mud appeared
There was a large pond not far from a town or village. After it rained heavily there the clams and mussels, and pebbles and gravel would vanish
In a mountain glen there was a lake, unruffled and free of waves
A ruler or their minister, while walking along the road with an army of four divisions, was to arrive at a forest grove where they set up camp for the night
